articles.author: Kristina Killgrove
articles.title: Ice age Europeans as young as 10 years old rocked cheek piercings 30,000 years ago - Livescience.com
articles.description: A study of Paleolithic skeletons from Central Europe suggests people's teeth were worn down and crowded together because of cheek piercings.
articles.content: Strange, flat patches on the teeth of ancient Europeans have puzzled archaeologists for centuries. But one researcher thinks he's solved the mystery: Ice age people as young as 10 years old rocked ch… [+3939 chars]
